version_description:
- Fix for login to panel for devices with 12h-time clock setting.
- Some other bug fixes

*Screen rotation for Image and video zoom
*Drag the alarm screen down in order to navigate the app during an alarm
*Multi panel support - upgraded to support up to 15 panels
*Support monitoring station on demand
*Capability to view the last known status of a disconnected panel
*Customized URL moved from phone settings to App's login page
*Added QR code reader for customized URL recognition (for OS7 devices and above)
*Counter displaying last app status update
*New App icon
*iPhone 6 and iPhone 6+ adjustments

· Home Automation support.
· Registration to the RISCO Cloud directly from the iRISCO application.
· Ability to disarm 24hr alarm zones while the system is in DISARMED state.
· iOS9 support.
Support of a Roller Shutter device, part of the Smart Home solution offering.

- Customized notification sounds
- Viewing video clips from the Event History
- Support of a Roller Shutter device as part of the Smart Home solution
- Service Push Notifications

- Customized notification sounds
- Viewing video clips from the Event History
- Support of a Roller Shutter device as part of the Smart Home solution
- Service Push Notifications

- Automatic exit delay when remotely arming (setting) a LightSYS™2 system (Version: 5.50)
- Technical internal improvements

· Supports additional smart home devices – Door Lock and Garage Door
· New graphical design for smart home icons
· Technical improvements and minor bug fixes.ok

Quick Buttons - perform activities while watching live video
Support of Greek language
Bug fixes

1. On screen controls to manage the new Pan/Tilt Camera
The new Pan/Tilt camera introduces new functionality into the iRISCO app, allowing the user to rotate the camera in any direction, horizontally (355°) and vertically (90°).
With a press on a Home button (located on the bottom left corner), the user can reposition the camera to its original startup position. In addition, the user can set 3 different presets, and with a press of the preset button the camera automatically turns to the predefined position.
A user can also zoom in/out, but the zoom is digital (optical zoom not supported by this camera).
Lastly, the camera can be mounted on a ceiling. In such a scenario, the user can flip the camera image 180° right from the iRISCO app.

2. Improved P2P connection time
This version improves the connection time to a VUpoint P2P camera by optimizing several steps leading to the connection. The improvement is more evident in subsequent connections to the same camera where a P2P video session was previously established.
3. Bug fixes

“Presence” – a new zone attribute
Panic button
User can resign from site
Company information details
Set times manually for the NVR playback
Support disabling Biometric Recognition
Support iPhone 11
Bug fixes
